page.title: 10HAVERGAL FESTIVAL
page.content:
Many visitors come from all over the world to see her grave and each year, on the Sunday nearest the anniversary of her death, a service is held at which her hymns are sung.{On {the centenary of her death, 3rd June {1879, a special Festival was held in {her memory.}Twenty-five related Havergals were at the service and later that month the{Choir of HAVERGAL {COLLEGE, TORONTO, CANADA,}sang in the church. The College was founded by men who admired her principles.
Part of the money raised by the Festival was used to{re-gild}the two faces of{the church clock}which had been erected in January 1836 by her father.
